table2.Notes: Incomplete - rudimentary scrolling, player sprite only

table2.Title: Attack of the PETSCII Robots
table2.Notes: Game coding only 15% complete; GS-specific graphics created. Development halted.

table2.Title: Bard's Tale III: Thief of Fate
table2.Notes: Programmer claims "was almost complete" (primarily missing graphics)

table2.Title: Deluxe Tetris
table2.Notes: Programmer claims game "complete and fully tested". May have seen limited distribution; Demo exists.

table2.Title: Diamonds
table2.Developer/planned_publisher: Richard Bennett, Sean Craig & Alex Lee

table2.Title: Dragon's Lair
table2.Notes: Reported in development. Prototype version spanning 16 floppy disks, used greyscale

table2.Title: Dragon's Lair: Escape from Singe's Castle
table2.Notes: Reports it was completed. Manual from other ports have IIGS loading instructions.

table2.Title: Dragon's Lair II: Time Warp
table2.Notes: Reports it was completed. Manual from other ports have IIGS loading instructions.

table2.Title: Final Destination
table2.Notes: Was to be included with Cosmocade; canceled due to being incomplete

table2.Title: Leisure Suit Larry Goes Looking for Love
Lode Runner
table2.Notes: Incomplete - no collision detection, missing sound effects

table2.Title: Mindshadow
table2.Notes: Early-stage port using 8-bit version as framework (missing GUI, sound or enhanced graphics)

table2.Title: Pinball Wizard
table2.Notes: Incomplete - game engine not fully complete, design bugs. Playable.

table2.Title: Puzznic
table2.Developer/planned_publisher: Ryan Ridges & John Lund / Taito America
table2.Notes: Finished - fully playable (unpublished due to Taito America closure)

table2.Title: Ragnarok
table2.Notes: Reported in development. Actual screen shot exists.

table2.Title: Renegade
table2.Notes: Reported in development at 1989 CES. Advertised available by Taito. Actual screen shots exist.

table2.Title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
table2.Notes: Incomplete - basic game engine only, no enemy AI or finished levels

table2.Title: Rick Dangerous
table2.Notes: Playable, sound engine needs work (low quality); bugs

table2.Title: S.D.I.
table2.Notes: Reported in development. Actual screen shots exist.

table2.Title: Sherlock: The Riddle of the Crown Jewels
Space Ace II: Borf's Revenge
table2.Notes: Reports it was completed. Manual from other ports have IIGS loading instructions.

table2.Title: Space Harrier
table2.Notes: Incomplete - no collision detection, sound effects, or ability to complete first level

table2.Title: Space Quest III: The Pirates of Pestulon
Super Mario Bros.
table2.Notes: Incomplete - missing levels and audio. Playable.

table2.Title: Sword of Sodan
table2.Notes: Incomplete - 5 of 11 levels missing enemy sprites or obstacles. Playable version shown at 1989 CES.

table2.Title: TimeLord
table2.Notes: Incomplete - lacks audio, unfinished map locations and story

table2.Title: Ultima V
table2.Notes: Reported in development by Origin staff

table2.Title: Ultima VI
table2.Notes: Claims preliminary work started before canceled. IIGS version mentioned on box and manual of ports.

table2.Title: UMS 2 - Nations at War
table2.Notes: Reported programmed by developer. Manual from other ports have IIGS loading instructions.

table2.Title: Wonder Bulla in Terrific Land
table2.Notes: Incomplete - no collision detection or audio. Unfinished levels.
